universum.studios.android.fragment.manage

Class FragmentRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.fragment.manage.FragmentRequest

  • public final class FragmentRequest
extends Object
    A request that may be used to replace|add|remove|show|hide|attach|detach a desired Fragment in a view hierarchy. New instance of request may be created via FragmentController.newRequest(Fragment) or via FragmentController.newRequest(int) for fragments provided by FragmentFactory. When request is created it may be configured via methods listed below and then executed via execute().

    Configuration

    • fragmentId(int)
    • outgoingFragmentId(int)
    • arguments(Bundle)
    • transaction(int)
    • tag(String)
    • viewContainerId(int)
    • transition(FragmentTransition)
    • transitionStyle(int)
    • enterTransition(Transition)
    • exitTransition(Transition)
    • reenterTransition(Transition)
    • returnTransition(Transition)
    • allowEnterTransitionOverlap(boolean)
    • allowReturnTransitionOverlap(boolean)
    • sharedElementEnterTransition(Transition)
    • sharedElementReturnTransition(Transition)
    • sharedElement(View, String)
    • #sharedElements(Pair[])
    • replaceSame(boolean)
    • addToBackStack(boolean)
    • executeAllowingStateLoss(boolean)
    • executeImmediate(boolean)

    Note, that each fragment request may be executed only once.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    FragmentController, FragmentRequestInterceptor

      static interface  FragmentRequest.Transaction
      Defines an annotation for determining available transaction types for transaction(int) method.

      • fragmentId

        public FragmentRequest fragmentId(int fragmentId)
        Sets an id of the fragment associated with this request.

        This id along with outgoingFragmentId() may be used to determine exact change between two fragments and configure this request accordingly when using FragmentRequestInterceptor.

        Parameters:
        fragmentId - The desired fragment id.
        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        fragmentId(), outgoingFragmentId(int)

      • sharedElement

        public FragmentRequest sharedElement(@NonNull
                                     View element,
                                     @NonNull
                                     String elementName)
        Adds a shared element view and its name for the associated fragment.

        Subsequent calls to this method will append list of already specified shared element pairs.

        Parameters:
        element - The view to be shared via transition.
        elementName - The name of the shared element.
        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        #sharedElements(Pair[]), FragmentTransaction.addSharedElement(View, String)

      • singleSharedElement

public <any> singleSharedElement()

        This method may be used to obtain a single shared element when there is specified only one for this request.

        Returns:
        Single shared element or null if there are no shared elements specified.
        See Also:
        sharedElements(), sharedElement(View, String)

      • replaceSame

        public FragmentRequest replaceSame(boolean replace)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether the already displayed fragment with the same TAG as that specified for this request may be replaced by the associated fragment or not.
        Parameters:
        replace - True to replace an existing fragment with the same TAG as specified via tag(String) with the associated one, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        replaceSame()

      • replaceSame

        public boolean replaceSame()

        Default value: false

        Returns:
        True if already displayed fragment with the same TAG may be replaced, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        replaceSame(boolean)

        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.

        @Deprecated
public FragmentRequest executeAllowingStateLoss(boolean allowing)
        Deprecated. Use allowStateLoss(boolean) instead.
        This method will be removed in the next release.

      • allowStateLoss

        public FragmentRequest allowStateLoss(boolean allow)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether FragmentTransaction for the associated fragment may be committed allowing state loss or not.
        Parameters:
        allow - True to allow state loss when committing transaction, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        FragmentTransaction.commitAllowingStateLoss(), allowStateLoss()

      • executeAllowingStateLoss

        @Deprecated
public boolean executeAllowingStateLoss()
        Deprecated. Use allowStateLoss() instead.
        This method will be removed in the next release.

      • allowStateLoss

        public boolean allowStateLoss()
        Returns boolean flag indicating whether to commit fragment transaction allowing state loss.

        Default value: false

        Returns:
        True if transaction may be committed allowing state loss, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        allowStateLoss(boolean)

      • executeImmediate

        @Deprecated
public FragmentRequest executeImmediate(boolean immediate)
        Deprecated. Use immediate(boolean) instead.
        This method will be removed in the next release.

      • immediate

        public FragmentRequest immediate(boolean immediate)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether FragmentTransaction for the associated fragment should be executed immediately or not.
        Parameters:
        immediate - True to execute immediately (synchronously), false otherwise (asynchronously).
        Returns:
        This request to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        FragmentManager.executePendingTransactions(), immediate()

      • executeImmediate

        @Deprecated
public boolean executeImmediate()
        Deprecated. Use immediate() instead.
        This method will be removed in the next release.

      • immediate

        public boolean immediate()
        Returns boolean indicating whether to execute fragment transaction immediately.

        Default value: false

        Returns:
        True if fragment transaction should be executed immediately (synchronously), false otherwise (asynchronously).
        See Also:
        immediate(boolean)

      • execute

        @Nullable
public Fragment execute()
        Executes this request via the associated FragmentController that was used to create this request instance.

        Note, that each request may be executed only once and any subsequent calls to this method will throw an exception.

        Returns:
        The fragment that has been associated with this request either during its initialization or as result of execution process. May be null if the execution has failed.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this request has been already executed.
        IllegalArgumentException - If current configuration of this request does not meet the requirements. For example, request with transaction type of REPLACE or ADD cannot be executed without view container id specified.

      • executed

        public boolean executed()
        Returns boolean flag indicating whether this request has been executed.
        Returns:
        True if execute() has been called for this request, false otherwise.
